TextView.android:text: 1)FPGA means
View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 Field Programmable Gate Array (FPGA) is the re-configurable hardware, which consists 
 of millions of logic gates which could be arranged according to the user's demand. They 
 also have much higher frequency compared to micro con
2)Which language could be used for programming an FPGA.
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n Verilog and VHDL are the hardware description languages that are used for the \n programming of FPGAs. Both of these languages are case-insensitive in nature.
3)What is mean by ALU
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n It is used for arithmetic operations.
4)Which one of the following is not a vectored interrupt?
View Answer
Answer : Option D \n Here TRAP, INTR, RST 7.5 are vectored interrupts. But RST 3 is not a vectored interrupt.
5)8085 microprocessor has how many pins
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 Intel 8085 NMOS microprocessor is a 8 bit, 40 pins IC. It is a 40 pin I.C. package fabricated 
 on a single LSI chip. The Intel 8085 uses a single + 5 V DC supply for its operation.Its clock 
 speed is about 3 MHz. The clock cycle is 320 ns. It has 80 basic instructions and 246 
 opcodes
6) In 8085 microprocessor, the RST6 instruction transfer programme execution to following location
View Answer
Answer : Option A
7)HLT opcode means

RadioButton.android:text: C)load accumulator with contents of register.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option D \n HLT opcode in 8085 microprocessor means end of program.
8) In 8085 name/names of the 16 bit registers is/are
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 Program counter (PC) and Stack pointer (SP) are basically used to hold 16 - bit memory 
 addresses. PC stores the 16-bit memory address of the next instruction to be fetched. SP 
 can be used to temporarily store the 16 - bit memory address as well as data. So PC and 
 SP are 16-bit registers.
9)What is SIM?
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n SIM stands for set interrupt mask which is handling the interrupts in 8085 microprocessor.
10) The ROM programmed during manufacturing process itself is called
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n The ROM programmed during manufacturing process itself is called MROM. Data is stored by the manufacturer during fabrication and user can not alter this data.
11)A combinational PLD with a fixed AND array and a programmable OR array is called a
View Answer

Answer : Option B 
 ROM – Fixed AND array and fixed OR array 
 PROM – Fixed AND array and Programmable OR array 
 PAL – Programmable AND array and fixed OR array 
 PLA – Programmable AND array and programmable OR array
12)A combinational PLD with a programmable AND array and a fixed OR array is called a
View Answer

Answer : Option C 
 ROM – Fixed AND array and fixed OR array 
 PROM – Fixed AND array and Programmable OR array 
 PAL – Programmable AND array and fixed OR array 
 PLA – Programmable AND array and programmable OR array
13)A combinational PLD with a programmable AND array and a programmable OR array is called a
View Answer

Answer : Option D 
 ROM – Fixed AND array and fixed OR array 
 PROM – Fixed AND array and Programmable OR array 
 PAL – Programmable AND array and fixed OR array 
 PLA – Programmable AND array and programmable OR array
14)A mask programmed ROM is

RadioButton.android:text: A)programmed at the time of fabrication

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 The ROM programmed during manufacturing process itself is called MROM. Data is stored by the manufacturer during fabrication and user can not alter the data. 
 In PROM data is stored by user. Only one time programmable and reprogramming is not possible. 
 In EPROM erasing is done using UV light and programming is through electrical.
15)The length of bus cycle in 8086/8088 is four clock cycles, T1, T2, T3, T4 and an indeterminate number of wait state clock cycles denoted by Tw. The wait states are always inserted between
View Answer
Answer : Option C \n The wait states are always inserted between T3 and T4.
16)Which one of the following circuits transmits two messages simultaneously in one direction
View Answer
Answer : Option B \n Diplex circuits transmits two messages simultaneously.
17)A microprocessor is ALU

RadioButton.android:text: A)and control unit on a single chip.
B) and memory on a single chip.
C)register unit and I/O device on a single chip.
D)register unit and control unit on a single chip.

TextView.android:text: View Answer
Answer : Option D \n A microprocessor is a semiconductor component designed by using VLSI technology and it contains ALU, Control unit (CU) and registers of a CPU in a single package.
18)Output of the assembler in machine codes is referred to as
View Answer
Answer : Option A \n Input to a assembler is the source program and assembler converts it into object program.
19) Which one of the following is not correct?

RadioButton.android:text: A)Bus is a group of wires
B)Bootstrap is a technique or device for loading first instruction
C)An instruction is a set of bits that defines a computer operation
D)An interrupt signal is required at the start of every program

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option D \n Interrupt is required for interruption of main program to perform a subroutine. It may be used at the start of some program as per requirement but it is not mandatory at start of every program.
20) The processor status word of 8085 microprocessor has five flags namely

RadioButton.android:text: A) S, Z, AC, P, CY
B) S, OV, AC, P, CY
C) S, Z, OV, P, CY

TextView.android:text: View Answer

Answer : Option A 
 8085 microprocessor has 5 status flag 
 S → Sign flag 
 Z → Zero flag 
 AC → Auxiliary carry flag 
 P → Parity flag 
 CY → Carry flag
